# Research Prospect
- LinkedIn 
- Online 
- TrustPilot Reviews

values.content:
=You are part of the business development team at artivance which is an AI consultancy. 

When a new leads book a consultation with artivance, your team researches the leads and provides the research + extracted insights to the consultants so they can read it prior to the consult. 

Your job is to create the following sections from the research:

- Personal Profile: The personal profile is a one paragraph summary of the person (lead) extracted from researching their LinkedIn profile.
- Interests: In this section you must identify a few of the leads interests from their most recent LinkedIn posts + their LinkedIn profile. 
- Unique Facts: In this section you must extract at least 2 unique facts about the lead that tells them you've really put time to research who they are. These facts should be things that are unique to the lead and out of the ordinary.
- Company Profile: The company profile is a one paragraph summary of the company the person represents, extracted from researching their company LinkedIn profile and available information on the web. 

Your output must be in HTML, following this format: 

Person Profile (Heading 2)
[Details]

Company Profile (Heading 2)
[Details]

Interests (Heading 2)
[List of interests in dot point format]

Unique Facts (Heading 2)
[List of unique facts in dot point format]


- Don't wrap the output in ```html``` since the output will go into the middle of another HTML document. Just make sure its in HTML language.

Create this output for the following research: 

LinkedIn Profile Research (in JSON format): 
{{ JSON.stringify($('Scrape LinkedIn Profile - Apify').last().json) || 'No profile data available' }}

Most Recent LinkedIn Posts: 
{{ $('Posts').last().json.postsHTML }}

Web Research: 
{{ $('Research Company - Perplexity').last().json.choices[0].message.content}}

=You are part of the business development team at Kamexa which is an AI consultancy. 

When new leads book a consultation with Kamexa, your team researches the leads and provides the research + extracted insights to the consultants so they can read it prior the consult. 

As an ice breaker for each call, [YOUR-NAME], which is Kamexa's AI consultant likes to point to a similarity between himself and the lead. This way the lead feels more comfortable talking to [YOUR-NAME] as a friend, rather than a stranger. 

To find these similarities you must compare [YOUR-NAME]'s LinkedIn profile to the leads LinkedIn profile. Look for any similarities you can find, including but not limited to education, experience, location, interests and so on. 

You might also not find any similarities. In this case then output No Similarities Found in the details section of your output. 

Your output must be in the following HTML format: 

Similarities (heading 2)
[Details in dot points with one similarity on each dot point]

- Don't wrap the output in ```html``` since the output will go into the middle of another HTML document.

The Leads LinkedIn Profile: 
{{ JSON.stringify($('Scrape LinkedIn Profile - Apify').last().json) || 'No profile data available' }}

[YOUR-NAME]'s LinkedIn Profile: 
[INPUT YOUR DETAILS HERE - YOU CAN SCRAPE YOUR PROFILE USING THIS WORKFLOW AND HARDCODE THE INFO HERE]

=You are part of the business development team at Kamexa. Kamexa is an AI Automation agency that provides the following services: 

- AI Consulting: Kamexa provides consultations to businesses looking to implement AI. 
- Process Automation: Kamexa automates processes that are repetitive, time consuming, high volume or error prone. These repetitive proccesses are automated with traditional rule based automations. 
- AI SaaS Development: For businesses that can automate their entire service, Kamexa creates a SaaS platform so that they can provide their services over the cloud in a one to many fashion. 
- AI Agent Development: Kamexa develops custom AI agents that can handle less repetitive tasks autonomously. Considering the current capabilities of AI agents, the tasks that they can complete have to be simple in scope. 

Kamexa's AI consultants are the first point of contact for a new lead. So when a new lead is interested in AI Automation solutions, they book a free call with Kamexa's AI consultants. The consultants are then responsible for exploring the highest ROI opportunities for automation.

Once a call is booked, your team does in depth research on the lead so that the consultants can read through it in preparation for the consultation. 

As part of the business development team you are provided with the following research: 

- LinkedIn Profile: This is the result of scraping the leads LinkedIn profile. This will give you the leads bio, experiences, education and company description.
- LinkedIn Posts: This gives you the leads LinkedIn posts over the past 30 days. 
- Company Google Search: This gives you the research found from searching the leads company on Google and their website. 
- Reviews: This gives you the most recent bad reviews the leads company received on TrustPilot. 

Your job is to analyse the research and extract following information: 

- Pain Points: By looking through the companies negative reviews and also considering their line of business and the leads position in the company, you must identify the biggest pain points the leads company could be facing. 
- Solutions to Pain Points: In this section you must come up with solutions Kamexa can offer to solve each of the pain points completely. 
- Highest ROI Automation Opportunities: Considering the info you have about the lead and his company, you must come up with the 5 highest ROI automation opportunities that Kamexa can offer them. These automations have to be realisitic, yet extremely high ROI. Sort them in order of best opportunity at the top of the list.  

The insights you extract must be in HTML format as they will be going in the middle of a HTML document. 

Please use the following output format: 

Opportunities (Heading 1)

Pain Points and Solutions: (Heading 2)
[Table with 3 columns: 
1. Pain Point: Explains the pain point theyre facing. 
2. Evidence: Explains why we think this is the case. 
3. Solution: Explains the solution to the pain point by Kamexa.
Each row is a new pain point.]

Automation Opportunities: (Heading 2)
[5 Highest ROI automation opportunities for the leads company sorted with the best solution at the top. This must be in dotpoint format:
- Opportunity#1 Name: Details
- Opportunity#2 Name: Details
...

- Don't wrap the output in ```html``` since the output will go into the middle of another HTML document.

Someone just booked a call. Here's the research your team found. Create the output as per the above requirements: 


LinkedIn Profile Scraped Summary in HTML format: 
{{ $('Person + Company Profile').last().json.message.content }}

Web Research Results for Leads Company: 
{{ $('Research Company - Perplexity').last().json.choices[0].message.content }} 

Recent Bad Reviews on TrustPilot for Leads Company in HTML format: 
{{ $('Reviews').last().json.reviewsHTML }}
(if there is no reviews then just create the pain points by considering the leads company and job title)

parameters.content:

- Similarities 
- Pain Points + Solutions

json.headline: Chairman and CEO at Microsoft
json.about: As chairman and CEO of Microsoft, I define my mission and that of my company as empowering every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more.

updates.postText: Three Microsoft CEOs walk into a room on Microsoft‚Äôs 50th anniversary ‚Ä¶ and are interviewed by Copilot!¬†

A couple reflections on the quantum computing breakthrough we just announced...

Most of us grew up learning there are three main types of matter that matter: solid, liquid, and gas. Today, that changed.

After a nearly 20 year pursuit, we‚Äôve created an entirely new state of matter, unlocked by a new class of materials, topoconductors, that enable a fundamental leap in computing.

It powers Majorana 1, the first quantum processing unit built on a topological core.

We believe this breakthrough will allow us to create a truly meaningful quantum computer not in decades, as some have predicted, but in years. 

The qubits created with topoconductors are faster, more reliable, and smaller. 

They are 1/100th of a millimeter, meaning we now have a clear path to a million-qubit processor. 

Imagine a chip that can fit in the palm of your hand yet is capable of solving problems that even all the computers on Earth today combined could not! 

Sometimes researchers have to work on things for decades to make progress possible.

It takes patience and persistence to have big impact in the world. 

And I am glad we get the opportunity to do just that at Microsoft. 

This is our focus: When productivity rises, economies grow faster, benefiting every sector and every corner of the globe. 

It‚Äôs not about hyping tech; it‚Äôs about building technology that truly serves the world. 

Read more about our discovery, and why it matters, here: https://aka.ms/AAu76rr

We have always been a platform- and partner-first company. And today we are building three trusted platforms to help you maximize your opportunity in this age of AI. Here are some highlights from my keynote this morning at #MSIgnite.

AI is the new input for every company to expand their output, and the rapid adoption of this technology and the intensity of its everyday use are the most important ways companies can get ahead today. Here are highlights from my keynote at #MSIgnite.

Imagine a chip that can fit in the palm of your hand yet is capable of solving problems that even all the computers on Earth today combined could not! Sometimes researchers have to work on things for decades to make progress possible. It takes patience and persistence to have big impact in the world. message.content:
## Company Overview

**What the Company Does (Products/Services)**
Microsoft is a global technology corporation primarily engaged in developing, licensing, and supporting a wide range of software products, services, and hardware devices. Its core offerings include:

- Operating Systems: Windows family (Windows 10, Windows 11, and upcoming Windows Server 2025)[4].
- Productivity Software: Microsoft 365 suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams).
- Cloud Services: Microsoft Azure, a leading cloud computing platform.
- Enterprise Solutions: Dynamics 365 (ERP and CRM), Power Platform.
- Developer Tools: Visual Studio, GitHub (acquired in 2018).
- Hardware: Surface devices, Xbox gaming consoles.
- Artificial Intelligence & Data: Azure AI, Copilot, and machine learning services.
- Other Services: Bing search engine, LinkedIn (acquired in 2016), and various cybersecurity solutions.

In addition to its established portfolio, Microsoft regularly updates its offerings, recently announcing new features and enhancements in Windows Server 2025 focused on security, performance, and flexibility[4].

**Company Size and Industry**
Microsoft is one of the world's largest technology companies, operating globally with over 220,000 employees as of 2024. It is consistently ranked among the most valuable publicly traded companies, with a market capitalization that has at times exceeded $3 trillion. Microsoft is a leader in the information technology industry, encompassing segments such as software, cloud computing, hardware, and digital services.

## Recent News and Developments

**Product Lifecycle Changes**
In 2025, Microsoft is retiring or ending support for approximately 120 products and services, including major offerings like Windows 10 (Home, Pro, Enterprise, Education, and IoT versions), Visual Studio App Center, Azure Database for MariaDB, and others[1][2][5]. The retirement schedule means these products will stop receiving security updates, technical support, and other services[1][5].

**Product Launches and Enhancements**
Microsoft has announced new features in Windows Server 2025, focusing on enhancements in security, performance, and deployment flexibility[4].

## Market Position and Competitors

Microsoft is a global leader in both software and cloud computing. It holds a dominant position in operating systems (Windows), productivity software (Microsoft 365), and enterprise cloud (Azure, the second-largest cloud provider after Amazon Web Services). Key competitors include:

- Amazon Web Services (AWS)
- Google (Alphabet/Google Cloud Platform)
- Apple (macOS, iOS, hardware)
- Salesforce (enterprise SaaS)
- Oracle (enterprise software and cloud)

## Company Culture and Values

Microsoft is known for fostering a growth mindset, innovation, and a commitment to diversity and inclusion. Its core values emphasize integrity, accountability, respect, and empowering individuals and organizations. Under CEO Satya Nadella, Microsoft has promoted collaboration, learning, and social responsibility, contributing to a significant cultural transformation.

## Financial Performance

Microsoft is publicly traded under the ticker MSFT on the NASDAQ. In its most recent fiscal year (FY24), Microsoft reported revenues exceeding $210 billion, with net income above $80 billion (figures may be slightly higher depending on late FY24/early FY25 results). Its main revenue streams are cloud services (Azure), Office productivity, Windows, and gaming (Xbox, Activision Blizzard).

## Key Leadership Team

- Satya Nadella ‚Äì Chairman and Chief Executive Officer
- Amy Hood ‚Äì Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
- Brad Smith ‚Äì President and Vice Chair
- Judson Althoff ‚Äì Executive Vice President, Chief Commercial Officer
- Scott Guthrie ‚Äì Executive Vice President, Cloud + AI Group
- Kathleen Hogan ‚Äì Chief Human Resources Officer

## Recent Partnerships or Acquisitions

**Product and Service Retirements**
Recent changes include the retirement of several Azure services and developer tools in 2025, indicating a shift in Microsoft's product focus and support lifecycle[5].

**Acquisitions and Partnerships**
While the provided search results do not detail recent acquisitions, Microsoft has historically expanded through significant acquisitions such as LinkedIn, GitHub, and Activision Blizzard. The company is known for frequent strategic partnerships and investments, particularly in AI (e.g., extended partnership with OpenAI) and cloud infrastructure.

---

Microsoft continues to lead in cloud innovation, workplace productivity, and AI, while regularly evolving its product portfolio through lifecycle management and strategic acquisitions[1][2][4][5].

json.reviewBody:
2025-05 Cumulative Update Preview
for Windows 11 version 24H2 for xbased systems
[KB5058499] install error 0x800f0983

None of the suggestions on the Microsoft support pages work.

Eleven years ago this was common and apparently it continues.

Totally useless.

json.reviewHeadline: Word is such a sub sub sub standard‚Ä¶
json.reviewBody: Word is such a sub sub sub standard software. The level is stupidity of it is beyond any negative expectation. Microsoft is a monopoly otherwise no one will use their softwares.

json.reviewHeadline: Activity prevents me from paying them.
json.reviewBody:
Activity prevents me from paying them.

They have a policy where if you use too many payment methods they lock your account from using any new method of payment. Effectively making my account useless after my next card expires. I have 12 years and thousands spent on it. 

Their solution: hang up on me cause they can‚Äôt explain how sweeping me under the rug is professional and good business.

json.reviewHeadline: If I could give a zero I would
json.reviewBody: If I could give a zero I would. Received a NON working Xbox. Support is giving me a run around bc I bought it thru Affirm. I can't even send it back for a refund. I'm contacting my lawyer. I will never purchase ur crap again.
Terrible. Signed up for a business account for 365 and can't get back in. No idea why?  Says my account is not recognised and there is no support. Just a bunch of unhelpful suggestions.

message.content:
Person Profile

Satya Nadella is the Chairman and CEO of Microsoft, a position he has held for over 11 years. Based in Redmond, Washington, he leads one of the world's largest technology companies with a mission to empower every person and organization to achieve more. Under his leadership, Microsoft has significantly advanced in cloud computing, AI, and quantum computing, while nurturing a culture of growth mindset and inclusion. Satya also serves on the boards of the University of Chicago and Starbucks, reflecting his commitment to education and global business.

Company Profile

Microsoft is a global technology corporation established in 1975, headquartered in Redmond, Washington. With over 220,000 employees, it develops, licenses, and supports a broad range of software products, services, and hardware devices. Key offerings include the Windows operating system, Microsoft 365 productivity suite, Azure cloud services, Dynamics 365 enterprise solutions, Surface hardware, Xbox gaming consoles, and LinkedIn. As a leader in the IT industry, Microsoft continually innovates in areas like artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, and quantum computing, maintaining a strong market position against competitors like AWS, Google, and Apple.

Interests

  • Artificial Intelligence
  • Quantum Computing
  • Cloud Computing
  • Enterprise Solutions
  • Technology Innovation

Unique Facts

  • Satya Nadella recently announced a groundbreaking quantum computing breakthrough at Microsoft, showcasing the development of Majorana 1, the first quantum processing unit built on a topological core.
  • He serves as a board member for both the University of Chicago and Starbucks, highlighting his diverse involvement in education and the global coffee industry.

Opportunities

Pain Points and Solutions:

Pain Point Evidence Solution
Update Deployment Failures Multiple reviews mention errors during Windows updates (e.g., error 0x800f0983) and lack of effective support solutions. Kamexa can implement AI-driven automated update management systems to ensure seamless and error-free update deployments, with proactive issue detection and resolution.
Poor Customer Support Experience Customers report encountering unhelpful support channels and inadequate problem resolution, leading to frustration. Deploy AI-powered customer service agents to provide 24/7 support, efficiently handle common issues, and escalate complex cases appropriately.
Payment Method Restrictions Reviews indicate issues with account locking when using multiple payment methods, rendering accounts unusable after card expirations. Automate payment processing and account management with AI to handle multiple payment methods seamlessly while maintaining security and functionality.
Software Quality Concerns Negative feedback on the performance and usability of software like Microsoft Word, highlighting it as substandard. Utilize AI for continuous software testing and quality assurance to identify and rectify defects proactively, enhancing user experience.
Hardware Reliability Issues Customers receive non-working hardware products like Xbox consoles and face difficulties in obtaining refunds or support. Implement AI-driven quality control and predictive maintenance for hardware products, along with automated support systems for returns and refunds.

Automation Opportunities:

  • AI-Powered Customer Support Chatbots: Deploy advanced AI chatbots to provide instant, accurate support responses, reducing wait times and improving customer satisfaction.
  • Automated Software Update Management: Implement AI systems to seamlessly manage and deploy software updates, minimizing failures and ensuring reliability.
  • AI-Driven Payment Processing Automation: Streamline payment handling with AI to manage multiple payment methods securely and efficiently, preventing account lockouts.
  • Predictive Maintenance for Hardware: Use AI to anticipate and address hardware failures before they occur, enhancing product reliability and customer trust.
  • Continuous Software Quality Assurance: Integrate AI tools for ongoing software testing and bug detection to maintain high standards of software performance.

Google Research Analysis

## Company Overview **What the Company Does (Products/Services)** Microsoft is a global technology corporation primarily engaged in developing, licensing, and supporting a wide range of software products, services, and hardware devices. Its core offerings include: - Operating Systems: Windows family (Windows 10, Windows 11, and upcoming Windows Server 2025)[4]. - Productivity Software: Microsoft 365 suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams). - Cloud Services: Microsoft Azure, a leading cloud computing platform. - Enterprise Solutions: Dynamics 365 (ERP and CRM), Power Platform. - Developer Tools: Visual Studio, GitHub (acquired in 2018). - Hardware: Surface devices, Xbox gaming consoles. - Artificial Intelligence & Data: Azure AI, Copilot, and machine learning services. - Other Services: Bing search engine, LinkedIn (acquired in 2016), and various cybersecurity solutions. In addition to its established portfolio, Microsoft regularly updates its offerings, recently announcing new features and enhancements in Windows Server 2025 focused on security, performance, and flexibility[4]. **Company Size and Industry** Microsoft is one of the world's largest technology companies, operating globally with over 220,000 employees as of 2024. It is consistently ranked among the most valuable publicly traded companies, with a market capitalization that has at times exceeded $3 trillion. Microsoft is a leader in the information technology industry, encompassing segments such as software, cloud computing, hardware, and digital services. ## Recent News and Developments **Product Lifecycle Changes** In 2025, Microsoft is retiring or ending support for approximately 120 products and services, including major offerings like Windows 10 (Home, Pro, Enterprise, Education, and IoT versions), Visual Studio App Center, Azure Database for MariaDB, and others[1][2][5]. The retirement schedule means these products will stop receiving security updates, technical support, and other services[1][5]. **Product Launches and Enhancements** Microsoft has announced new features in Windows Server 2025, focusing on enhancements in security, performance, and deployment flexibility[4]. ## Market Position and Competitors Microsoft is a global leader in both software and cloud computing. It holds a dominant position in operating systems (Windows), productivity software (Microsoft 365), and enterprise cloud (Azure, the second-largest cloud provider after Amazon Web Services). Key competitors include: - Amazon Web Services (AWS) - Google (Alphabet/Google Cloud Platform) - Apple (macOS, iOS, hardware) - Salesforce (enterprise SaaS) - Oracle (enterprise software and cloud) ## Company Culture and Values Microsoft is known for fostering a growth mindset, innovation, and a commitment to diversity and inclusion. Its core values emphasize integrity, accountability, respect, and empowering individuals and organizations. Under CEO Satya Nadella, Microsoft has promoted collaboration, learning, and social responsibility, contributing to a significant cultural transformation. ## Financial Performance Microsoft is publicly traded under the ticker MSFT on the NASDAQ. In its most recent fiscal year (FY24), Microsoft reported revenues exceeding $210 billion, with net income above $80 billion (figures may be slightly higher depending on late FY24/early FY25 results). Its main revenue streams are cloud services (Azure), Office productivity, Windows, and gaming (Xbox, Activision Blizzard). ## Key Leadership Team - Satya Nadella ‚Äì Chairman and Chief Executive Officer - Amy Hood ‚Äì Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer - Brad Smith ‚Äì President and Vice Chair - Judson Althoff ‚Äì Executive Vice President, Chief Commercial Officer - Scott Guthrie ‚Äì Executive Vice President, Cloud + AI Group - Kathleen Hogan ‚Äì Chief Human Resources Officer ## Recent Partnerships or Acquisitions **Product and Service Retirements** Recent changes include the retirement of several Azure services and developer tools in 2025, indicating a shift in Microsoft's product focus and support lifecycle[5]. **Acquisitions and Partnerships** While the provided search results do not detail recent acquisitions, Microsoft has historically expanded through significant acquisitions such as LinkedIn, GitHub, and Activision Blizzard. The company is known for frequent strategic partnerships and investments, particularly in AI (e.g., extended partnership with OpenAI) and cloud infrastructure. --- Microsoft continues to lead in cloud innovation, workplace productivity, and AI, while regularly evolving its product portfolio through lifecycle management and strategic acquisitions[1][2][4][5].
